fact: Honey never spoils. Archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old and still perfectly edible.
Bananas are berries, but strawberries are not.
A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus.
Sharks have been around longer than trees.
Octopuses have three hearts.
An adult human has 206 bones, but a newborn baby has around 270.
Wombat poop is cube-shaped.
There are more stars in the universe than grains of sand on Earth.
Cows have best friends and can become stressed when separated from them.
Humans share 60% of their DNA with bananas.
It takes 8 minutes and 20 seconds for light from the Sun to reach Earth.
Butterflies taste with their feet.
The Eiffel Tower can grow more than 6 inches during the summer due to the expansion of iron in the heat.
The unicorn is the national animal of Scotland.
Humans are the only animals that blush.
The smell of freshly cut grass is actually a plant distress signal.
A single teaspoon of honey represents the life work of 12 bees.
Koalas sleep up to 22 hours a day.
A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance'.
The shortest war in history was between Britain and Zanzibar on August 27, 1896. Zanzibar surrendered after 38 minutes.
Slugs have four noses.
There are more trees on Earth than stars in the Milky Way galaxy.
A bolt of lightning contains enough energy to toast 100,000 slices of bread.
Elephants are the only animals that can't jump.
A crocodile cannot stick its tongue out.
An ostrich's eye is bigger than its brain.
Tomatoes were once considered poisonous in Europe.
There are more fake flamingos in the world than real flamingos.
Hot water freezes faster than cold water, known as the Mpemba effect.
The world's smallest reptile was discovered in 2021. It is a tiny chameleon that fits on the tip of a finger.
Sea otters hold hands while sleeping to avoid drifting apart.
If you lift a kangaroo’s tail off the ground, it can't hop.
The heart of a shrimp is located in its head.
The human nose can detect over 1 trillion different scents.
A snail can sleep for three years.
There is only one letter that doesn't appear in any U.S. state name: Q.
Polar bears have black skin under their white fur.
The inventor of the Frisbee was turned into a Frisbee after he died.
The wood frog can hold its pee for up to eight months.
The longest hiccuping spree lasted for 68 years.
Tigers have striped skin, not just striped fur.
The average person will spend six months of their life waiting for red lights to turn green.
A group of owls is called a parliament.
A jiffy is an actual unit of time—1/100th of a second.
The blob of toothpaste that sits on your toothbrush is called a 'nurdle.'
Dolphins have names for each other.
Humans and giraffes have the same number of neck vertebrae—seven.
The average human body contains enough fat to make seven bars of soap.
The Great Wall of China is not visible from space without aid.
Your fingernails grow faster on your dominant hand.
Cows have almost 360-degree panoramic vision.
Dragonflies have six legs but can't walk.
It’s impossible to hum while holding your nose.
The Empire State Building has its own zip code.
One piece of space junk returns to Earth every day.
Venus is the only planet in the solar system that rotates clockwise.
Carrots were originally purple, not orange.
A group of porcupines is called a 'prickle.'
The average human sheds around 600,000 particles of skin every hour.
The Guinness World Record for the longest hiccuping spree lasted for 68 years.
In Switzerland, it is illegal to own just one guinea pig.
Apples float because they are 25% air.
Walt Disney was afraid of mice.
The dot over the letter 'i' and 'j' is called a 'tittle.'
Bees can recognize human faces.
It takes a photon 40,000 years to travel from the core of the Sun to its surface, but only 8 minutes to reach Earth.
Squirrels plant thousands of new trees each year simply by forgetting where they put their acorns.
Sloths can take up to a month to digest a single leaf.
Pineapples were so expensive when they first arrived in Europe that people would rent them for parties.
The longest place name on the planet is 85 letters long.
Giraffes have no vocal cords.
The average person walks the equivalent of five times around the world in their lifetime.
There are more cells of bacteria in your body than there are human cells.
Wombat poop is cube-shaped to prevent it from rolling away.
The oceans contain enough salt to cover all the continents in nearly 500 feet of salt.
Human thigh bones are stronger than concrete.
A day on Mercury lasts 1,408 hours.
Elephants are the only animals that can’t jump.
The oldest 'your mom' joke was discovered on a 3,500-year-old Babylonian tablet.
Cows moo in regional accents.
Ants don’t sleep.
Sharks are older than the rings of Saturn.
The inventor of the match died by setting himself on fire.
A group of jellyfish is called a 'smack.'
A group of crows is called a 'murder.'
It is physically impossible for pigs to look up into the sky.
A crocodile can’t stick out its tongue.
An eagle can kill a young deer and fly away with it.
Penguins propose to their mates with a pebble.
The average person spends six months of their lifetime waiting for a red light to turn green.
A giraffe's tongue is so long it can lick its own ears.
Octopuses have blue blood and nine brains.
When in danger, the sea cucumber expels its internal organs.
Tarantulas can survive for more than two years without food.
Banging your head against a wall burns 150 calories an hour.
If you sneeze too hard, you can fracture a rib.
An apple, potato, and onion all taste the same if you eat them with your nose plugged.
